name: Brian Samson
objective: A challenging software engineering position either working independently or on a motivated, experienced, and intelligent team.

experience.title: Owner
experience.description: Freelance software consulting for small and medium size businesses. I can develop almost anything you can imagine, from custom Android applications to full-featured web applications in Java, Ruby on Rails, PHP, or ASP.NET. As the principle owner, I take pride and responsibility in delivering nothing but the highest quality software to all my clients.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: Six Fried Rice is a small custom software firm, and I was the lead Rails developer. Our focus on custom software for small and medium businesses means that I was responsible for more than just writing code. I regularly designed (both graphically and architecturally) both front- and back-end systems, integrated with 3rd party APIs, and also administered web and database servers.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: I was the lead developer of a 5-man team for Trimble Outdoors' 4 mobile Java applications. These apps are GPS-based and originally targeted J2ME, but have expanded to iOS and Android platforms. I wrote mostly Java for devices and C#.NET for the website, web services, and a related Windows desktop application. I also wrote and maintained a J2EE/JSF webapp to manage the build process.

experience.title: Technology Support Analyst, Sr
experience.description: I started as a student worker at the e-mail helpdesk but rapidly rose to a Classified Staff position. I administered our MS Exchange server, helped customize and deploy ASU's first student webmail system, helped out on a huge variety of J2EE applications from student registration to Websphere and Tomcat app management. In '05-06 I led the team responsible for ASU's new student portal "MyASU."
